subject: SUBWAY SUPERBOWL!!!
event:
Well, okay, the chances are remote... for but one week, at least, I can entertain myself with the possibility, faint as it may be.  The Giants and the Jets are both in the playoffs.

The Jets got in yesterday, when they defeated the woeful Raiders in the Meadowlands.  (Sorry about that, Lodey).  Oakland was 2-13 coming in, so Gang Green was heavily favored... but I have been a Jets fan for a long, line time, and when you're a Jets fan you learn never to take anything for granted.  The Same Old Jets of years past would have found a way to blow this game, and the playoffs with it.  They do seem to have turned a corner under the kid coach Eric Mangini, however.  For once, they are beating teams they ought to beat.  To their credit, the Raiders did not roll over, although their own season ended months ago.  They played hard, especially their tough young defense, and made a tight game of it until the fourth quarter.  The Jets wanted it more, however.  Chad Pennington played a smart, careful, efficient game, and finished the first full sixteen-game season of his career with a convincing win.  And Leon Washington, the rookie the Jets picked with the draft choice they got for former coach Herman Edwards, sealed the win with another nifty, darting run.  

On paper, the Jets are probably the least talented of the twelve teams to make the playoffs.  In fact, they have less talent than several teams that will be staying home in January (the Panthers, Bengals, and Broncos all come to mind).  They play tough and smart, however, and unlike the Same Old Jets of yore, they seldom shoot themselves in the foot.  That's what I like so much about them.  I have a soft spot for underdogs and overachievers.

As for the Giants, their playoff berth was not certain until a few of Sunday's games fell out in certain ways, but they had largely assured themselves of a berth the night before when they defeated the Washington Redskins to finish the season at 8-8.  That's after starting the season at 6-2, mind you.  The victory over the Redskins was anything but convincing.  It wasn't the Giants that beat the 'Skins as much as it was Tiki Barber.  Last season, Tiki set a franchise rushing record in a game against the Kansas City Chiefs (I blogged about it at the time).  On Saturday he broke his own record, rushing for 234 yards and 3 touchdowns.  It was another amazing performance from a great player, and had me high-fiving Parris and shouting TIKI!  TIKI!  TIKI! at the television set.  Even so, the Giants barely held on to win.  Some "experts" claim that Eli Manning played much better, but I don't know what game they were watching.  In the game I watched, Eli completed less than half his throws and passed for only a hundred yards and change.  And some of his misses were just as errant as in past weeks.  (One of them actually hit a Redskins DB in the ass).  

Tom Coughlin did actually take my advice (posted here last week) and insert Jared Lorenzon in the game... but only for a quarterback sneak, alas.  The Hefty Lefty got the first down, but then left the game again.  Ah, well.  At least he took a snap.  

The Giants defense looked as bad as Eli.  Time and time again, Tiki would deliver what should have been the crushing blow, only to have the defense let Washington answer with a score of their own, and put the issue in doubt again.  The young Redskins QB Jason Campbell looked like the second coming of Vince Young at times. Yes, the defense has suffered on a lot of injuries, but still... they should be much better than this.  New York Giants football has always meant DEFENSIVE football.  Even in their worst years, the Giants have always fielded a tough defense.  It makes me sick to see them getting pushed around this way.  

The Giants are the mirror image of the Jets.  On paper, they have as much talent as any team in the NFL, and should be able to beat anyone.  On paper, there's no reason why they should not be able to go all the way to the SuperBowl.  Alas, the games are not played on paper.  It all comes down to coaching, which is why I still want Tom Coughlin fired, playoffs or no playoffs.  Eric Mangini has the Jets giving 200 per cent of themselves, while Coughlin is getting maybe 50 per cent out of the Giants (except for Tiki, of course.  I am going to miss him so much next season).

So now I have one week to savor the playoffs before Wild Card Weekend will be upon us.  Both of my teams play on Sunday.  The Jets will be going up to Boston to play the Patriots, the Giants down to Philadelphia to play the Eagles.  Bitter archrivals and division foes, in both cases, and in both cases this will be the third meeting of the season -- a rubber game, since both regular season series were split 1-1.  The home teams will be favored in both games, and rightfully so.  Next weekend could see both my teams eliminated.  Until and unless that happens, however, I will go on clinging to my hopes.  Maybe the Jets will continue to surprise the pundits... maybe the G-Men will finally wake up and play at their talent level... maybe this will be the year we get that Subway Superbowl.

(So says my heart.  My head keep telling me it will be the Chargers and the Saints in the Superbowl this year).

comments.article:
Pats will put a serious smackdown on the Jets. Yes, the Jets played good ball this year, but their schedule was very weak.

The teacher will school the student.

But hey, you should be writing instead of watching football!!!
comments.subject: Belichick the teacher.

comments.article:
*sigh*
do you know what people do in their free time? Is it any of your business?
No teacher teaches 24/7, and no writer writes 24/7 either. Let the man live his life, for goodness sake!
comments.subject: Re: Belichick the teacher.

comments.article: good luck to the Giants and the Jets. They'd deserve to win. =D
I'm not a football fan, just wanted to wish you a happy new year. :]
Came to say the exact same thing. :)

GRRM, I love your novels and I love the fact that you're also a football fan. So many lovers of fantasy turn their noses up at sports, but I've never found them to be mutually incompatible interests whatsoever.

I was at a animation convention in Baltimore a summer or two. The Ravens were playing a preseason game approximately a mile away. Aside from the difference in testosterone levels, I was struck by how similar the two groups of fans were - brightly colored costumes representing their favorite players or characters, painted faces, enjoying their own respective brands of escapist entertainment filled with outlandish (and, it could be said contrived!) battles.

comments.upictitle: Something Clever Here: BSG Starbuck Laugh
comments.article: This is an interesting and important observation. It's interesting and important to me, mainly as it allows me to say "GO RAVENS!" :)

It is heart vs head on the other side of the continent as well. Here's hoping the Seahawks have surprises in store. I wouldn't put it past them to beat the Cowboys at home. I've been to Allen's masterpiece of a stadium, it is just as loud as foretold.

Alas, we're out a starting corner and two backup corners. T.O. just might get the field day he always thinks he should have.

Seahawks are gonna get crushed. I don't even like Dallas, but Seattle can't stop the run, they get beat routinely on deep balls, they're without two good receivers and most of their secondary (which wasn't good to begin with)...and home field advantage doesn't matter that much this season, especially since the 49ers showed the world what paper tigers the Hawks are.

I love Qwest field, and I wish I knew why the defense has regressed so much, but the Hawks are the worst team in the playoffs. Yeah, even worse than the Giants.

Well, of the two games the Jets have the better chance to win, especially if Wilfork stays out. The Jets have shown they can beat the Pats...but I don't see the Pats losing this early. Still will be rooting for them, if only to torture Stego a bit.

The Giants against Philly...sorry, don't see it happening. Eli is a mess, the team has no chemistry and they're horrible against the deep ball, which Philly does really well.

I think it's the Saints and Chargers too. I'd love to say my Bears will make it to the superbowl, but I don't see Rex leading the team past two decent (much less good) teams in a row, regardless of it being in Chicago. Add to that the weird collapse of the defense, and I think they might win one before bowing out in the NFC championship. As to SD - I think the only way they lose is if Rivers has some horrible meltdown. Which is possible, but not likely.

Happy New Year, and good luck to your teams!

I'd love for the Bears to make it to the Superbowl too, but after last night's game against the Packers...ugh.  I could barely stand to watch it.  I think the Bears will fall to the Saints in the NFC championship game as much as I hate to say it.

When I saw your subject line I thought that was the sponsor of the SB and that Jared would be the one to toss the coin at the beginning of the game (Subway Sandwiches). *Must be a New Year's Day response* LOL

Yes, the Raiders once again need to look to next year. Of course, Al Davis will completely waste the draft pick his team gave him and pick an oft-injured rebel who has great prospects but will never achieve squat.

I'm glad that Tiki has had such a great season. It will be sad to see him go.

Since the G-men made the playoffs, does that mean that Coughlin has a job up to game 4 of next year?

Jets! Jets! Jets!!! *Might as well be them...unless it's SD!!!*

here's to hoping the beloved chargers dont tank first round.

AGAIN.

:-\

Hmm I guess we all want out teams to win. It would be very storybook to see the Saints make it to the big game. Though I personally want to see the Cowboys and Ravens make it.

The Giants are a good team but I have grown up a Cowboys fan so I can't really say I am cheering for them.

Regardless of what happens, it should be good to watch.

You didn't mention anything about Dance...just saying. :)

And happy new year sir. :)
...They're big, mean, and knocked my Steelers ALL OVER the field. I'm just saying they're badass.
comments.subject: Don't discount the Ravens...

comments.article: Yes we are!  And proud of it.  And you might want someone to check out Ben.  he appears to have PTS from the 11/26 game.
comments.subject: Re: Don't discount the Ravens...

comments.upictitle: Rum, Sodomy, and the Lash: Pick Two: monkey pirate
comments.article:
As a Philadelphian, and therefore subject the only two holy commandmments of Philly; 1. Thou shalt love thy team, the Eagles. and 2. Thou shalt hate the Dallas Cowboys - I have to hope the Birds win against the Giants.

That said, I'd take any New York team against these West Coast nerds, any day. There's just something about the Chargers that irritates me.

Oh, and I saw Tiki Barber here in LA this week. Weird.

Manning passed for *only* a hundred yards and change? Do you have any idea how happy a number like that would make me?

You people are spoiled rotten. Rotten, I tell ya! ;)
It'd probably reduce a lot of traffic if you could take the subway to the Meadowlands.

Since when have we been able to comment O_o aaanyway...

I LOVE your books and just wanted to say, Happy New Year!!

I'm afraid i'm completely clueless when it comes to American Football don't really see much of it in the UK (although i do have an Iranian friend who plays, but that's just confusing). I wish your teams luck!

sorry, but as a louisianian i'm hoping the saints make it to the super bowl. we deserve it, after rooting for a losing team for so many years. :P

and happy new year! :D

GRRM, as an Eagles fan I have to hope that your Giants get beat on Sunday at the Linc.

We got a little revenge recently for that week 2 gift we gave the Giants, but I still want a little more payback!

Go Eagles!

E.A.G.L.E.S. EAGLES!!!


good luck to the jets though ^_^

Would be great to receive a Christmas/NY present in a form of a new sample. Oh, let's say Jon, or Tyrion 2, or whatever. Just an idea.

Kesky

P. S. It's probably rude of me to come out with this, and say nothing about American Football, but that would make my post even more rude.

P. P. S. Happy New Year everybody. Have a great one.

My Broncos were trying to make the playoffs, and to our disappointment, they didn't make it. We all thought this was horrible news.

Then we woke up this morning.

Darrent Williams, starting CB for the Broncos, was shot to death last night. He has two young children. Suddenly, not making the playoffs seems like a small thing.

George, would you consider a character named Darrent for some small part in the book?

Ah, oh well. Happy football season to you. Just wait til next year...
Eric
comments.subject: Football Tragedy.

comments.article: Nothing personal, but I was really rooting for the Redskins on the off, off, chance of a Bears vs Green Bay Superbowl. Maybe them, I reckoned, Favre would realize it was time to retire.
Ummmmmm you do of course realize that the Bears & Packers can never play in the Superbowl right??? Unless they realign the league somehow.
comments.subject: Superbowl?

comments.article: As a long suffering and die-hard Chargers fan, it looks like we will finally make it to the big dance and hopefully we will not choke this time. Like GRRM, Chargers fans do not take anything for granted. This year we have a well balanced team and the rookie QB is exciting to watch (when our eyes are not on LT). GO CHARGERS!
comments.subject: Bolt Head

comments.article: seriously.  if the chargers tank first round this season, im going to cry.  and desperately want to quit on them, even though i cant.
comments.subject: Re: Bolt Head

comments.article:
Next Year.

Ugh... As much as I cringe at the thought, the Baltimore Ravens will probably win it all.
comments.subject: And the Giants win the SuperBowl!!!

comments.article: Damn right Chargers will!!!!!!! Booyaaa!!

I am rooting for both true NY teams - Buffalo doesn't count (though we let Jersey fans share because they host the games at their meadowlands). At the start of the season I was really impressed with the Giants, but they just fell apart half way through with one crippling last minute loss after another.

A subway series would be great, though if only one team can make it in from NY I hope it is the Jets. Pennington and the team have put a lot of effort in, especially considering the potentially career ending injury Pennington suffered last season.

Just thought i would wish you a happy new year. I havn't posted before but have been an avid fan for too long now. My only gripe is i always have to re read your last book because you take your time writing. while i find this perfectly acceptable when one considers the amount of detail that all your books tend to entail i do find my self getting worried that you will never finish them. While i am sure that you are currently in the best of health the last year hasn't exactly been kind to my favorite authours indeed i had considered you, robert jordan, and david gemmell to be some of if not the finest high fantasy writers currently writing and yet now gemmell has very sadly passed anway leaving his works unfinished and robert jordan has had to spend the last year and a half fighting a heart condition i cannot even spell. Fortunatly he seems to be making progress. I guess im just worried about you! However i have every faith in your health and respect the best way to stay healthy is enjoyment.

But please no more delays!
comments.subject: Happy New Year and all That Jazz!

comments.article:
P.s. From Thomas Evans

www.myspace.com/kingtom!
comments.subject: Re: Happy New Year and all That Jazz!
